text: was one of the first business magazines of Japan. The magazine, published monthly, was based in Tokyo. ==History== Jitsugyō no Nihon was started in 1897. The first issue appeared on 10 June 1897. The founding publisher was Dainihon Jitsugyo Gakkai. Later it was published by a company with the same name, Jitsugyō no Nihon Sha, Ltd., which was founded by Masuda Yoshikazu in 1900. Masuda Yoshikazu was the first editor and Shibusawa Eiichi was among the regular contributors. The magazine was published on a fortnightly basis and later on a monthly basis The headquarters was in Tokyo. Jitsugyō no Nihon covered articles about economy, finance and current affairs. It also offered information about business targeting people with no formal education on the subject. The magazine was one of the supporters of Japan's participating in World War II. ==References== Category:1897 establishments in Japan Category:Defunct magazines published in Japan Category:Biweekly magazines Category:Business magazines published in Japan Category:Monthly magazines published in Japan Category:Magazines established in 1897 Category:Magazines published in Tokyo Category:Magazines with year of disestablishment missing
